TopicTitle: Accelerando's Average Wares: .17-proof Medium-Heavy Lifters, IP, and other nonsense

Articles.Content:
So ignoble this shouldn't even need a tagline.

These are reliable, efficient rockets and vehicles that are meant to facilitate heavy crewed expeditions and settlement of Kerbin's moons and beyond. They are not necessarily easy to fly, so keep your eyes on the throttle.

All of my stock rockets require a few .cfg edits, or bugfixes, to work as they should:

The large decoupler fix

The fuel bug fix

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Medium-Heavy Lift Vehicles

Temperance Kerbin Ascent Bus

A 3-person booster system that can heft a decent-size payload into a 70km circular orbit, decouple its ascent stage, and land the ascender safely on Kerbin. On launch, the four drop-tanks on each side run dry at somewhat more than midway through the brightest bar of atmosphere.

MechJeb: For controlling the discarded stage.

Landing notes:

Keep in mind that landing with the "safe" payload mass will still require tricky throttle and decent maneuvering. Launching to orbit with the maximum payload should leave you somewhat less than 300L of propellant left to work with in each larger, outer tank. MechJeb's usual stabilization features will probably be useless here. Instead, turn on MechJeb's Surface information panel, warp to a point at which you will feel comfortable executing your deceleration burn, and burn so that your periapsis reaches about 1/8th of Kerbin's circumference away from your landing site.

The landing itself will require two burns:

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Begin the first deceleration burn at no less than 1.7 km true altitude, and continuing until just beyond 600m to slow you down to less than 80m/s. (This is to ensure the parachutes don't detach.)

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Begin the final burn at about 400-250m above the surface, depending on how confident you feel. Do not throttle hard.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Adjust final thrust carefully to slow your descent to 2-1m/s by the time you are 10m or less above Kerbin's surface.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢When you reach 5m or so, hit X (MECO). This will allow you to touch down safely without the risk of jumping back up once the parachutes disappear.

Max Safe Payload:

29.9 Tonnes

Max Unsafe Payload:

30.6 Tonnes

Propellant Mass

106 Tonnes

Efficiency@Max

3.55T propellant/ton payload

Edited September 13, 2012 by Accelerando
Can't believe I forgot to add the link.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Interplanetary Lander

Zeno Small Interplanetary Lander + Orbiter

With 2 SRBs, one liquid-fuel bus, and 3 rings of linear port RCS thrusters for a final stage propulsor, this one-Kerbal vehicle can just make it off the surface of Kerbin and into a low-medium orbit (recommended 100-140km circular). It's hoped that this will be enough to escape Eve, Laythe, or Duna. Just remember that if the target world's gravity is anything like Kerbin's, you won't have enough propellant to make it back home alone. Hope you brought friends!

(If not used for landing, it is capable of very deep-system voyages and returns.)

MechJeb: For controlling the discarded stage.

Mass (Lander):

10.5 Tonnes

Mass (Lander+Interplanetary Bus):

28.75 Tonnes

Download:

Without boost stages: http://www./?a887jwssgaazdms
